title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far -- and a few other fits for the free agent first baseman

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: The Fate of Travis Kelce? Chiefs TE to wait on '26
content: Chiefs star tight end Travis Kelce says he will decide by early March whether to come back for a 14th season in 2026, saying he wants Kansas City to know his future before free agency.

title: LSU formally acts to fire Kelly in response to suit
content: The LSU board of supervisors authorized new university president Wade Rousse to send former Tigers football coach Brian Kelly a formal notice of termination during a meeting on Friday, according to The Advocate in Baton Rouge.

title: Sources: Liberty tab Warriors' DeMarco as coach
content: The Liberty have agreed to a deal to hire Chris DeMarco, who has been with the Warriors since 2012, as their new coach, sources told ESPN.

title: LaMelo denies Hornets trouble: 'Love being here'
content: LaMelo Ball says he wants to stay with the Hornets despite the team's struggles and increasing speculation about his future from outside the organization.

title: Sources: Two Dodgers execs working with Lakers
content: Two key executives with the Los Angeles Dodgers, Farhan Zaidi and Andrew Friedman, have stepped into new advisory roles with the Los Angeles Lakers as the team transitions ownership to Mark Walter and TWG Sports.

title: Kansas star Peterson to miss 3 games in Vegas
content: Kansas star freshman Darryn Peterson will miss the Players Era Festival in Las Vegas next week due to his hamstring strain, coach Bill Self told reporters.

title: NCAA: Ex-Temple player bet against own team
content: A former Temple men's basketball player placed dozens of bets on Owls games over two seasons, including wagering against his own team, the NCAA announced.

title: üèà Reid's debut rankings for 2026 NFL draft
content: Jordan Reid unveils his initial rankings for the 2026 draft class, with the top 50 players, scouting reports and standouts at every position.

content: Eric Morris has tutored QBs from Patrick Mahomes to Cam Ward and John Mateer. How he mentors them is key to their successes and his.

title: The wild rise of BYU's Bear Bachmeier

content: Stewie's dominance. Taurasi's confidence. Collier's efficiency. UConn's Sarah Strong has all that -- and more.

content: How can all 32 NFL teams improve during the offseason? We took an early look at positional needs, free agents to watch and intriguing draft fits.

content: The Avalanche's reign atop the list continues, and the Blackhawks break into the top 10. Here's the full list.

title: Grading preseason bold predictions for all 32 NHL teams
content: Some of our wild takes from September don't look so wild anymore. Others are way off base. Here's an update.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Derbies galore with Arsenal vs. Spurs, plus NWSL Championship
content: It's Friday and a full weekend of action awaits across the soccer calendar. So who better to tee up the best matches than Julien Laurens? In a new weekly feature, he picks out the best of the action ahead.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: Players to watch at reborn SEC volleyball tournament
content: Torrey Stafford at Texas, Brooklyn DeLeye at Kentucky and Ifenna Cos-Okpalla at Texas A&M prepare to step into the spotlight of an SEC volleyball tournament that has been dormant for 20 years.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 12: Target the Brissett-Wilson combo in Arizona
content: If bye weeks or injuries have you seeking lineup help, consider the Cardinals passing game and a sneaky defense.

content: An all-encompassing look at matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores.

title: Wetzel: Is the NCAA infraction system now too speedy to be fair?
content: In an effort to speed up infractions rulings, the NCAA implemented a new system in 2023 for low-stakes cases.

title: USC-Oregon: Why to bet on the Ducks' defense to prevail in Eugene
content: No. 7 Oregon is nearly a double-digit favorite at home against No. 15 USC, and the Ducks matchup up well against the Trojans' style of offense.

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Tsarukyan can reenter title contention
content: MMA experts give their predictions for a UFC Fight Night from Doha, Qatar, headlined by lightweight contenders Arman Tsarukyan and Dan Hooker.

title: How Mbapp√©'s start at Real Madrid compares to greats like Ronaldo, Benzema
content: Kylian Mbapp√© has reached 75 games at Real Madrid in his best form since joining them. How does his start compare to some of the club's greatest strikers?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Scott McTominay back
content: Manchester United are considering a move to bring Scott McTominay back to Old Trafford from Napoli. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Michigan State, other men's No. 1 class contenders, 5-star intel, more
content: Teams that won (Michigan State) and have work to do (Kentucky), plus the latest on uncommitted five-stars.

title: PM Modi Meets Indian origin Tech Entrepreneurs In Johannesburg
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday interacted with Indian origin tech entrepreneurs and members of the Indian community based in South Africa and called upon them to deepen their engagement with India.

title: 72-Year-Old Mumbai Woman Duped Of Rs 32 Lakh
content: In yet another instance of a senior citizen being duped with the threat of a bogus criminal case, a 72-year-old woman in the city has lost Rs 32.8 lakh to fraudsters, police said on Friday.

title: Zelensky Rebuffs US Plan To End War, Says Won't 'Betray' Ukraine
content: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday warned he will not "betray" his country as he pushed back on a US plan to end the war on terms favourable to Moscow, acknowledging he risked losing Washington as an ally.

title: RBI Announces Interlinking Of UPI With European Instant Payment System
content: In a significant move, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday has announced the interlinking of Unified Payments Interface (UPI) with the TARGET Instant Payment Settlement (TIPS) of the Eurosystem.

title: US Government Cancels October Inflation Report After Shutdown
content: The US government said Friday that it will not publish a consumer inflation report covering the month of October, as a record-long shutdown hampered its data collection.

title: China's War On Christianity Deepens As 18 Zion Church Leaders Arrested
content: In one of the largest crackdowns on underground Christian groups in recent years, Chinese authorities have formally arrested 18 leaders of the Beijing Zion Church, according to Christian rights organisation ChinaAid.

title: Explained: What's Behind Nigeria's Latest School Abductions, Church Attack
content: Nigeria has grabbed global headlines again following a spate of attacks by gunmen involving the kidnapping of dozens of students from two

title: 9 Dead, Over 300 Injured In Bangladesh After 5.5-Magnitude Earthquake
content: A powerful earthquake struck outside Bangladesh's crowded capital Dhaka on Friday, killing at least nine people and injuring more than 300, authorities said.

title: India Resumes Tourist Visa For Chinese Citizens After 5-Year Suspension
content: In a significant step towards normalising bilateral ties, India is learnt to have resumed issuance of tourist visas to Chinese citizens worldwide-- a move ending a five-year suspension imposed following the 2020 Galwan clash.

title: Storm In A Saucepan? How Carbonara Sauce Stirred Up Trouble At EU Parliament
content: A jar of "carbonara sauce" for sale at the European Parliament in Brussels has whipped up Italian emotions after criticism it doesn't contain the right ingredients.

title: "Deeply Touched": PM Modi On His Welcome By Indians In South Africa
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who arrived in South Africa's Johannesburg on Friday to attend the G20 Leaders' Summit, lauded the rousing welcome given by members of the Indian community, highlighting that India's vibrant cultural diversity was on ful

title: 'Could Form Basis Of Final Settlement': Putin Welcomes US Peace Plan
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday cautiously welcomed a U.S. proposal to end Moscows nearly four-year war in Ukraine, saying it "could form the basis of a final peace settlement."

title: Madvi Hidma's Killing Has Broken Maoists' Backbone: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister
content: The elimination of top commander Madvi Hidma in an encounter earlier this week has broken the backbone of the Maoists, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai said on Friday.

title: Grizzly Bear Attack On School Children And Teachers In Canada Injures 11
content: A grizzly bear attacked a group of schoolchildren and teachers on a walking trail in British Columbia, Canada, injuring 11 people, two of them critically.

title: China Building World's 1st Artificial Floating Island That Can Survive Nukes
content: China is in the process of building a 78,000-tonne artificial island designed to withstand nuclear blasts. It is a mobile, semi-submersible, twin-hull platform that could support 238 people for four months without the need of new supplies.

title: How Ukraine Intelligence Used AI Lover, Beer To Nearly Kill Russian Official
content: Russia's Federal Security Service (FSB) says it has uncovered a plot to poison a high-ranking Russian officer in an attack allegedly disguised as a gift from an online love interest.

title: "Wipe My A**": Ex-CIA Man On Pak Apology Demand Over 'India Will Win' Remark
content: A controversy has erupted after former CIA officer John Kiriakou revealed that former Pak PM Imran Khan's party, the Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, tried to coerce him into apologising for comments he made on the conflict between Delhi and Islamabad.

title: US Plan Sees Ukraine Ceding Territory Same Size As Luxembourg: Report
content: The US peace plan for Ukraine could see Russia gain an area almost the same size as Luxembourg without a fight, according to an AFP analysis of data provided by the Institute for the Study of War (ISW).

title: "At Air Shows, You Are Much Closer To Ground": Retired IAF Vice Chief On LCA Tejas Crash
content: Air Marshal Anil Chopra (retired) has explained to NDTV the likely immediate steps the authorities would take as they begin to investigate the crash of an LCA Tejas in an airshow in Dubai today.

title: Hate Lessons: How Kerala Mother Helped UK-Based Man Radicalise Her Teen Son
content: The Kerala Police FIR into the alleged ISIS indoctrination of a 15-year-old boy identifies his mother as an active participant in the effort to radicalise him, working in coordination with a UK-based ISIS supporter.

title: Demolition a political exercise in Varanasi, should be stopped, says Akhilesh
content: Mr. Yadav, who met the aggrieved traders of Varanasi‚Äôs Dal Mandi at the Samajwadi State Office in Lucknow, said that the political demolition of Varanasi Dal Mandi should be stopped

title: Sangai Festival begins in Manipur amid protest
content: The State‚Äôs Rajya Sabha member, Leishemba Sanajaoba, accuses an IPS officer of barging into his residential compound

title: When faction terror reached Hyderabad with blood, gore and bombs
content: The 1997 Jubilee Hills car bomb blast, which claimed 25 lives, brought Rayalaseema‚Äôs violent feuds to the capital city‚Äôs doorstep. Today, the site is just another bend in the road, but for those who witnessed the carnage, the memories remain sharp and unsettling

title: Telangana MLA‚Äôs plan to connect underserved Jukkal residents to top doctors through telemedicine
content: Local legislator Thota Laxmikantha Rao in talks with doctors of Christian Medical College-Vellore to collaborate for setting up telemedicine kiosks in the remote constituency; aim is to reduce dependence on distant hospitals and improve rural healthcare access

title: Cong. rules out poll alliancewith¬†MNS; expect¬†Pawar¬†to act as mediator:¬†Sena¬†(UBT)
content: Can‚Äôt join hands with forces that stir communal violence, says Mumbai Cong. chief; Sharad Pawar refrains from commenting on issue; should fight together to defeat BJP: leader of Uddhav‚Äôs party

title: Deve Gowda, HDK re-elected JD(S) national and State presidents respectively
content: The party‚Äôs national council took a unanimous decision at the event to mark 25 years of formation of the regional outfit

title: Kalalaku Rekkalu, the girl student education scheme from next academic year, says Lokesh
content: HRD Minister Nara Lokesh reviews higher-education initiatives, announces a five-member committee to prevent student suicides and directs action against unapproved private colleges

title: Unlike Prime Minister, I will always meet fishermen: Stalin
content: Speaking virtually in a event held on the occasion of World Fisheries Day, he says the Centre must initiate strong steps to avoid the challenges and loss of lives suffered by the fishermen of Tamil Nadu in the hands of the Sri Lankan Navy

title: Punish those behind ‚Äòlapses‚Äô that led to Kashmir police station explosion: Mirwaiz, Ruhullah
content: Aga Syed Ruhullah termed it insensitive to have a tailor, a tehsildar, and a naib-tehsildar handling the explosives without a professional hand around.

title: First case registered against Christian missionaries under Rajasthan‚Äôs new anti-conversion law
content: The police have issued notices to the two pastors ‚Äì Chandy Varghese from New Delhi and Arun John from Kota ‚Äì while claiming that they promoted conversion and baptised several people during the programme

title: Malegaon shuts down as people demand justice for rape and murder of 3-year-old
content: Thousands gather outside Malegaon court demanding death penalty for accused in rape and murder of 3-year-old girl; police resort to lathi charge as protest turns violent.

title: Initiative launched to help pensioners submit life certificate digitally
content: Under Secretary to Department of Pension and Pensioners Affairs says it will help ease the process through a mobile application Jeevan Praman

title: India-Canada thaw: PM Modi to meet Carney at G20; leaders push to rebuild ties
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his Canadian counterpart Mark Carney will meet at the G20 summit in Johannesburg, aiming to rebuild ties strained by the 2023 killing of a Khalistan separatist.

title: Ukraine-Russia conflict: Putin welcomes US peace plan as 'final settlement'
content: In a diplomatic twist, President Putin of Russia expressed a measured acceptance of a US proposal aimed at peace in Ukraine, indicating it might pave the way for a resolution. However, he criticized Kyiv for what he termed as an unrealistic stance.

title: Afghanistan trade push: Kabul offers tax breaks, 1% duty; seeks deeper ties with India
content: Afghanistan is wooing Indian investors with a five-year tax holiday for new industries and a 1% import duty on raw materials and machinery. Commerce Minister Nooruddin Azizi highlighted priority sectors like cement and textiles, urging Indian companies to invest. He also sought India's help in keeping the Chabahar trade route open amidst logistical challenges.

title: ‚ÄòRivals closing in‚Äô: Altman warns of Google, Anthropic push - what memo to ChatGPT employees said
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledged Google's AI advancements could temporarily impact the company, but expressed confidence in catching up.  Despite ChatGPT's user engagement cooling, Altman urged employees to focus on achieving superintelligence, emphasizing OpenAI's strength to navigate competition from rivals like Google and Anthropic, even as Google benefits from cloud services.

title: Ladakh violence probe: Panel warns against threats; urges eyewitnesses to 'speak freely'
content: A judicial commission investigating the Sept 24 Leh violence has warned against threatening eyewitnesses, assuring confidentiality for those who come forward. The commission, formed after demands from local political groups, is urging people to share information freely before hearings begin. Evidence submission is open until November 28.

title: Zohran Mamdani and Donald Trump meeting: What to expect ‚Äî and what‚Äôs on agenda
content: In a surprising twist, New York City‚Äôs newly elected Mayor Zohran Mamdani will sit down with President Trump at the White House. This unexpected dialogue follows a history of pointed critiques between the two leaders. The agenda? Tackling NYC's affordability crisis, bolstering economic stability, and enhancing public safety.

title: UK settlement rules: Indian diaspora slams longer ILR waits; fears rise for care workers
content: New proposals for UK settlement status have drawn widespread criticism from the Indian diaspora. Foreign nationals arriving from 2021 onwards may face a 10-year wait for permanent residency, with care workers facing 15 years. This significantly alters the UK's attractiveness for skilled workers and students.

title: Amazon layoffs: Nearly 40% cut targets engineers‚Äî company's steepest cut in 31 years
content: Amazon is cutting approximately 14,000 corporate jobs, with nearly 40% of those in New York, California, New Jersey, and Washington being engineering roles, disproportionately affecting mid-level software engineers. CEO Andy Jassy cited cultural shifts and a desire for leaner operations as the primary drivers, not financial or AI pressures, though AI efficiency is expected to shrink headcount in the future.

title: Labour codes: Govt sees big-bang reform shift; unions warn of fresh confrontation
content: The Centre's implementation of four labour codes, a significant reform post-farm laws, aims to prepare industry for global uncertainty and extend social protection to unorganized workers. Despite trade union protests, the government is confident of garnering support from millions of contractual and platform workers who have been largely neglected.

title: Railin‚Äô Nalin: Nikki Haley‚Äô son, Punjab da grand-puttar, goes anti-immigrant
content: Nalin Haley, son of former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley, is making waves in Republican politics with his hardline anti-immigration views, including calls to end H-1B visas and restrict foreign students. His stance sparks debate on whether he betrays his immigrant heritage or represents a new wave of Gen-Z conservative frustration, diverging sharply from his mother's more internationalist approach.

title: 'Must rapidly rethink AI': Nadella's wake-up call; issues internal memo to employees
content: Google has launched Nano Banana Pro, an advanced AI image generator powered by Gemini 3. This upgrade offers superior reasoning, enhanced world knowledge, and precise text rendering. Users can now create higher-resolution images, control lighting and camera angles, and integrate real-time Google Search data, marking a significant leap for creative professionals.

title: J&K: ‚ÄòPotential terror plot‚Äô foiled in Handwara; M4 rifles seized from hideout
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir thwarted a potential terror plot in Handwara, recovering M4 rifles and other ammunition. A joint operation in the Neeriyan forest area led to the discovery of a major hideout. Separately, police are inspecting doctors' lockers in medical institutions to prevent misuse.

title: POSH Act for advocates: SC to hear plea on applicability; notice issued to HC ruling
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea challenging a Bombay High Court ruling that the Workplace Harassment Act doesn't apply to advocates. The court issued a notice of appeal, emphasizing that professional bodies should have internal complaints committees to ensure a safe workplace for women in the legal profession.

title: Aug landslide deaths: Police find no negligence in shrine board; await final report
content: A police report submitted to a judicial magistrate's court found no evidence of negligence by Shrine Board officials in the deaths of over 30 pilgrims during an August landslide. The action taken report stated no offense was established against the authorities, though a final report from a three-member committee is still awaited.

title: Savannah James gets emotional as daughter Zhuri joins new SZN Volleyball team
content: Savannah James celebrated her daughter Zhuri Nova's milestone as she begins her volleyball journey with the popular SZN team. Despite her family's basketball background, Zhuri Nova chose a different athletic path. The proud mother shared heartwarming clips and reflected on Zhuri Nova's 11th birthday, highlighting her daughter's intelligence and confidence.

title: LiAngelo ball goes platinum with breakout hit ‚ÄúTweaker‚Äù featuring Drake
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: Stephen Curry‚Äôs wife earns major nomination at 2025 Glossy Beauty Awards
content: Ayesha Curry's beauty brand, Sweet July Skin, has earned a nomination for Best Category Launch at the 2025 Glossy Beauty and Wellness Awards for its successful Lip Treatment. This recognition follows previous accolades for the brand, highlighting its growing impact in the beauty industry. The winners will be revealed on December 2, 2025.

title: Exclusive | From ‚Äòsurviving on rice and water in Russia‚Äô to 'burnout': Vidit's story
content: The FIDE World Cup 2025 in Goa is nearing its end. Indian Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi has spoken out against criticism of the tournament's conditions. He highlights Goa's beauty and excellent hospitality. Gujrathi also discusses his friendship with Anish Giri and his own journey with burnout. He will next play in the Global Chess League 2025.

title: Thaw in ties: India expand tourist visa services worldwide for Chinese nationals
content: Indian diplomatic missions globally have resumed accepting tourist visa applications from Chinese nationals, a significant step following the resolution of military tensions in eastern Ladakh. This move, which began earlier this week, follows the earlier resumption of tourist visas in July and is part of broader citizen-focused initiatives to strengthen bilateral ties.

title: Mega shift in Bihar cabinet: CM Nitish gives home portfolio to BJP; who got what
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has finalized his expanded cabinet, assigning portfolios after his tenth swearing-in. The BJP, as the largest party, received key ministries including Home, Land and Revenue, and Health. Smaller allies like LJP(R), HAM, and RLM have also been allocated significant departments, following a grand ceremony attended by national leaders.

title: Rs 95 lakh per semester paid for Karisma's daughter, Priya's lawyer shows receipt in court
content: A Delhi High Court hearing saw Priya Kapur's legal team present strong evidence refuting claims of a forged will by Sunjay Kapur. Documentation, including fee receipts and digital trails, countered allegations, while the court examined the will's creation and authenticity. The case continues on November 21.

title: IND vs BAN: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's shock no-show in super over ‚Äì here's why
content: India A's Asia Cup Rising Stars campaign ended in a shocking Super Over loss to Bangladesh A, marred by a controversial decision to omit in-form batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Despite a late collapse from Bangladesh forcing the tie, India's Super Over batting imploded, scoring zero runs. This strategic blunder proved catastrophic, leading to their elimination.

title: China building nuke-proof floating island: To prowl seas by 2028; what will it be used for?
content: China is reportedly constructing a massive, nuclear-blast-resistant floating artificial island, a 78,000-tonne semi-submersible platform designed for self-sustaining, long-term residency. Expected to be operational by 2028, this "mega science infrastructure" will accommodate 238 personnel and operate in contested waters, signaling a significant expansion of China's maritime power and "blue economy" agenda.

title: Tejas fighter jet crashes in Dubai during air show; IAF confirms pilot dead
content: Tragedy struck the Dubai Air Show as an Indian Air Force Tejas fighter jet crashed during an aerobatic display, resulting in the pilot's fatal injuries. The HAL-built aircraft nosedived, causing a massive fireball and panic among spectators. Emergency teams responded swiftly to the incident. The IAF expressed deep regret over the loss of life.

title: Bitcoin sinks below $82k; tech slump spills into crypto markets- what analysts say
content: Bitcoin and ether experienced significant drops to multi-month lows as investors retreated from riskier assets due to concerns over stretched tech valuations and diminished expectations of near-term US rate cuts. The broader crypto market has seen its value plummet by $1.2 trillion in six weeks, signaling a shift away from speculative investments.

title: 'It‚Äôs been hard': Brittany Mahomes opens up on emotional toll of NFL spotlight
content: Brittany Mahomes, wife of NFL star Patrick Mahomes, has candidly shared her struggles with online hate. She revealed that while it's been a difficult journey, she's learned to protect her peace by stepping away from social media when negativity escalates. Despite facing criticism for her opinions and public presence, she remains a strong supporter of her husband and their family.

title: Bangladesh‚Äôs comical fielding gifts India Super Over at Asia Cup Rising Stars - Watch
content: In a dramatic turn of events, India forced a Super Over after Bangladesh fumbled a seemingly easy win. A critical run-out error by the wicketkeeper on the final ball of India's innings allowed them to tie the score. The subsequent Super Over saw India collapse, losing both wickets for zero runs, capping a chaotic finish.

title: From 'Widow-Maker' to market shaker: Why Japan‚Äôs bonds are sending shockwaves globally
content: Japan's bond market is experiencing a seismic shift as yields rise, ending decades of ultra-loose monetary policy. A massive stimulus package coincides with the Bank of Japan stepping back, rattling markets and potentially triggering capital repatriation. This marks a critical juncture for the world's most indebted nation.

title: After Orry Shraddha Kapoor‚Äôs brother Siddhanth Kapoor summoned in drug case
content: Actor-director Siddhanth Kapoor, brother of Shraddha Kapoor, has been summoned by Mumbai Police's Anti Narcotics Cell in a Rs 252 crore drug case. His name reportedly surfaced in connection with lavish parties attended by celebrities and individuals linked to the underworld. Kapoor is expected to record his statement on November 25.

title: Why the Internet keeps going down every few weeks
content: The internet experiences major outages every few weeks due to increasing centralisation‚ÄîAWS, Google Cloud, and Azure now power most online services, creating single points of failure. Technical issues like DNS problems, configuration errors, and automation failures cascade across interconnected systems. Despite redundancy efforts, these outages disrupt emergency services, banking, and transportation.The decentralised internet envisioned for resilience has become a fragile network dependent on a few massive providers.

title: Broncos‚Äô Jahdae Barron responds to backlash over Taylor Swift nod after Chiefs win
content: Denver Broncos cornerback Jahdae Barron delivered a career-defining performance, limiting Travis Kelce to minimal production in a 22-19 upset win. However, a lighthearted postgame social media joke referencing Taylor Swift quickly ignited backlash, overshadowing his impressive defensive effort and sparking a viral controversy.

title: TNPSC results 2025: AP prosecutor, grade-II, group-IV and technical services
content: TNPSC Group 2 results 2025: The Tamil Nadu Public Service Commission (TNPSC) has declared the final results for the Assistant Public Prosecutor, Grade-II in Prosecution Department (Tamil Nadu General Service), Combined Civil Services Examination-IV (Group-IV Services), and Combined Technical Services Examination (Non-Interview Posts) today, November 21, 2025. Candidates can check their results online via the official TNPSC portal using their Registration Number and Date of Birth. Step-by-step instructions and direct links are provided for easy access to the results.

title: Race for rare earths: US, Russia look beyond China ‚Äì here's what's drawing focus
content: A global race is on to secure Arctic resources, particularly rare earths, as nations seek alternatives to China's dominance. Melting ice is unlocking Greenland's mineral wealth, attracting significant investment and sparking discoveries of crucial metals for electronics and defense. Sweden is also developing its own substantial rare earth deposits, though challenges in remote Arctic mining remain.

title: Asia Cup Rising Stars | India all out for 0: How Super Over drama unfolded
content: In a stunning Asia Cup Rising Stars semifinal, Bangladesh A defeated India A in a dramatic Super Over. After both teams tied at 194, India A collapsed to 0/2 in the Super Over. Bangladesh A, needing just one run, secured victory on a wide ball after a missed stumping, ending a truly unforgettable contest.

title: Crackdown on terror: J&K cops bust hideout; rifles, grenades seized
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district have thwarted a potential terror plot by recovering a substantial cache of arms and ammunition from a hideout near the Line of Control. The haul included M4 assault rifles, Chinese pistols, hand grenades, and numerous live rounds, discovered during a search operation in the Neeriyan Forest area.

title: Don‚Äôt wait for ‚Äòright time‚Äô! How 5-yr delay in investment can cost you - explained
content: Procrastinating on investing due to fear of market timing is a common pitfall, costing individuals significant wealth over time. Professionals cannot reliably time the market, and waiting for perfection allows time to work against you. Starting, even small and simple, is crucial for long-term growth.

title: Inside Smriti Mandhana-Palash Muchhal‚Äôs haldi ceremony
content: Indian cricket star Smriti Mandhana and composer-filmmaker Palash Muchhal's wedding festivities have begun with vibrant Haldi celebrations.  Smriti's teammates joined the joyous occasion, dancing with the bride.  Earlier, Palash shared a touching proposal video from DY Patil Stadium. With the wedding set for November 23, 2025, excitement is palpable for the couple.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Malti Chahar's brother and cricketer Deepak Chahar enters the show
content: During family week on Bigg Boss 19, contestant Malti Chahar was thrilled when her brother, cricketer Deepak Chahar, made a surprise visit. In a delightful promo, Deepak playfully wakes Malti from her slumber, making light-hearted jokes about her culinary skills while requesting a homemade feast. His unexpected arrival lifted Malti's spirits, providing a cheerful distraction from her feelings of homesickness.

title: No non-teaching duties for teachers, says HRD Minister Lokesh
content: 200 issues have been resolved out of 423 brought to his attention by the Federation of Andhra Pradesh Teachers‚Äô Organisations, Lokesh tells APTF leader

title: PAC questions FSSAI for unchecked sale of adulterated food items
content: The committee also drew attention to the Comptroller and Auditor General‚Äôs (CAG) report, which highlighted an acute shortage of manpower within the FSSAI

title: Punjab‚Äôs Tarn Taran by-poll verdict: Congress to take corrective measures, says Baghel
content: Congress party‚Äôs candidate Karanbir Singh Burj finished fourth, staying behind the Independent Mandeep Singh, who got almost 5,000 more votes than the Congress

title: Umar Khalid has ‚Äòscant regard‚Äô for Constitution, will quote Article 21 only for bail, Delhi Police tell Supreme Court
content: Khalid, other accused seeking bail after five years in jail as undertrials; police claim accused are delaying criminal proceedings; showing CCTV videos of 2020 riots, police say violence was pre-planned

title: Madras High Court quashes FIR booked against Aadhav Arjuna for inflammatory tweet
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira says the TVK leader, a beginner in politics, cannot be equated with a multi-faceted personality like S.Ve. Shekher

title: IWAI signs MoUs to enhance water transport and river tourism in the North East
content: A second MoU with the Government of Assam focuses on developing a water metro in Guwahati, Tezpur and Dibrugarh

title: Valley-wide crackdown on hospital lockers, car sellers continue
content: The police said the inspection drives were conducted ‚Äúto ensure transparency and proper adherence to security protocols‚Äù

title: Sources: Temple extends Fisher through 2030
content: Derrian Ford buries shot against Hofstra Pride (0:19) Temple  coach Adam Fisher has received a two-year extension through 2030, sources told ESPN. Fisher initially signed a five-year deal when he was hired in 2023 to replace Aaron McKie, who spent four years as the Owls' coach. In Fisher's first season at the helm, Temple finished 16-20 overall, but peaked toward the end of the season. The Owls won four of six to end the regular season and then made a run to the American Conference title game before falling to  UAB . Temple went 17-15 overall last season, finishing 9-9 in the league and beating regular-season champion  Memphis  in January. Temple has started 3-1 this season. Before taking over at Temple, Fisher spent two seasons as the associate head coach under Micah Shrewsberry at  Penn State  and six seasons as an assistant coach at  Miami  under Jim Larranaga.

title: Look at the 'ugly corners' for the best value in Week 13 of the CFB season
